member.name: T:Fable.AST.ExtendedNumberKind
member.summary: Numbers that are not represented with JS native number type

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Position
member.summary: Each Position object consists of a line number (1-indexed) and a column number (0-indexed):

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ExportAllDeclaration
member.summary: An export batch declaration, e.g., export * from "mod";.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ExportDefaultDeclaration
member.summary: An export default declaration, e.g., export default function () {}; or export default 1;.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ExportNamedDeclaration
member.summary: An export named declaration, e.g., export {foo, bar};, export {foo} from "mod"; or export var foo = 1;. Note: Having declaration populated with non-empty specifiers or non-null source results in an invalid state.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ExportSpecifier
member.summary: An exported variable binding, e.g., {foo} in export {foo} or {bar as foo} in export {bar as foo}. The exported field refers to the name exported in the module. The local field refers to the binding into the local module scope. If it is a basic named export, such as in export {foo}, both exported and local are equivalent Identifier nodes; in this case an Identifier node representing foo. If it is an aliased export, such as in export {bar as foo}, the exported field is an Identifier node representing foo, and the local field is an Identifier node representing bar.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ImportDeclaration
member.summary: e.g., import foo from "mod";.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ImportNamespaceSpecifier
member.summary: A namespace import specifier, e.g., * as foo in import * as foo from "mod".

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ImportDefaultSpecifier
member.summary: A default import specifier, e.g., foo in import foo from "mod".

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ImportSpecifier
member.summary: An imported variable binding, e.g., {foo} in import {foo} from "mod" or {foo as bar} in import {foo as bar} from "mod". The imported field refers to the name of the export imported from the module. The local field refers to the binding imported into the local module scope. If it is a basic named import, such as in import {foo} from "mod", both imported and local are equivalent Identifier nodes; in this case an Identifier node representing foo. If it is an aliased import, such as in import {foo as bar} from "mod", the imported field is an Identifier node representing foo, and the local field is an Identifier node representing bar.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ModuleSpecifier
member.summary: A specifier in an import or export declaration.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ClassExpression
member.summary: Anonymous class: e.g., var myClass = class { }

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ClassProperty
T:Fable.AST.Babel.SequenceExpression
member.summary: A comma-separated sequence of expressions.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.CallExpression
member.summary: A function or method call expression.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ConditionalExpression
member.summary: A conditional expression, i.e., a ternary ?/: expression.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.MemberExpression
member.summary: If computed is true, the node corresponds to a computed (a[b]) member expression and property is an Expression. If computed is false, the node corresponds to a static (a.b) member expression and property is an Identifier.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.SpreadProperty
member.summary: e.g., var z = { x: 1, ...y } // Copy all properties from y

member.name: P:Fable.AST.Babel.YieldExpression.delegate
member.summary: Delegates to another generator? (yield*)

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.DoExpression
T:Fable.AST.Babel.ArrowFunctionExpression
member.summary: A fat arrow function expression, e.g., let foo = (bar) => { /* body */ }.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Super
member.summary: A super pseudo-expression.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.FunctionDeclaration
member.summary: A function declaration. Note that id cannot be null.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ForOfStatement
member.summary: When passing a VariableDeclaration, the bound value must go through the `right` parameter instead of `init` property in VariableDeclarator

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ForInStatement
member.summary: When passing a VariableDeclaration, the bound value must go through the `right` parameter instead of `init` property in VariableDeclarator

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.TryStatement
member.summary: If handler is null then finalizer must be a BlockStatement.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.CatchClause
member.summary: A catch clause following a try block.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.SwitchCase
member.summary: A case (if test is an Expression) or default (if test === null) clause in the body of a switch statement.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ContinueStatement
member.summary: Contineu can optionally take a label of a loop to continuue

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.BreakStatement
member.summary: Break can optionally take a label of a loop to break

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.LabeledStatement
member.summary: Statement (typically loop) prefixed with a label (for continuue and break)

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.EmptyStatement
member.summary: An empty statement, i.e., a solitary semicolon.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.BlockStatement
member.summary: A block statement, i.e., a sequence of statements surrounded by braces.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ExpressionStatement
member.summary: An expression statement, i.e., a statement consisting of a single expression.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Program
member.summary: A complete program source tree. Parsers must specify sourceType as "module" if the source has been parsed as an ES6 module. Otherwise, sourceType must be "script".

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Directive
member.summary: e.g. "use strict";

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Identifier
member.summary: Note that an identifier may be an expression or a destructuring pattern.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.MacroExpression
member.summary: Not in Babel specs, disguised as StringLiteral

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.EmptyExpression
member.summary: Placeholder, doesn't belong to Babel specs

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.ModuleDeclaration
member.summary: A module import or export declaration.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Declaration
member.summary: Note that declarations are considered statements; this is because declarations can appear in any statement context.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Expression
member.summary: Since the left-hand side of an assignment may be any expression in general, an expression can also be a pattern.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Babel.Node
member.summary: The type field is a string representing the AST variant type. Each subtype of Node is documented below with the specific string of its type field. You can use this field to determine which interface a node implements. The loc field represents the source location information of the node. If the node contains no information about the source location, the field is null; otherwise it is an object consisting of a start position (the position of the first character of the parsed source region) and an end position (the position of the first character after the parsed source region):

member.name: P:Fable.AST.Fable.ApplyInfo.lambdaArgArity
member.summary: If the method accepts a lambda as first argument, indicates its arity

member.name: P:Fable.AST.Fable.ApplyInfo.ownerFullName
member.summary: Sometimes Fable.Type may differ from original F# name (e.g. System.Object -> Fable.Any). This field keeps the original name.

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Fable.Declaration.EntityDeclaration
member.summary: Module members are also declared as variables, so they need a private name that doesn't conflict with enclosing scope (see #130)

member.name: M:Fable.AST.Fable.Entity.TryGetFullDecorator(System.String)
member.summary: Finds decorator by full name

member.name: M:Fable.AST.Fable.Entity.TryGetDecorator(System.String)
member.summary: Finds decorator by name

member.name: T:Fable.AST.Fable.ValueKind.Lambda
member.summary: isArrow: Arrow functions capture the enclosing `this` in JS

member.name: M:Fable.AST.Fable.Util.compareConcreteAndGenericTypes(Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{Fable.AST.Fable.Type},Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{Fable.AST.Fable.Type})
member.summary: Helper when we need to compare the types of the arguments applied to a method (concrete) with the declared argument types for that method (may be generic) (e.g. when resolving a TraitCall)

member.name: M:Fable.AST.Fable.Util.makeApply(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpOption{Fable.AST.SourceLocation},Fable.AST.Fable.Type,Fable.AST.Fable.Expr,Microsoft.FSharp.Collections.FSharpList{Fable.AST.Fable.Expr})
member.summary: Checks if an F# let binding is being applied and applies arguments as for a curried function

member.name: M:Fable.AST.Fable.Util.tryImported``1(System.Lazy{System.String},``0)
member.summary: Ignores relative imports (e.g. `[<Import("foo","./lib.js")>]`)

member.name: T:Fable.Core.Applicable
member.summary: DO NOT USE: Internal type for Fable dynamic operations

member.name: T:Fable.Core.EmitAttribute
member.summary: Function calls will be replaced by inlined JS code. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Import-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.EraseAttribute
member.summary: Used for erased union types and to ignore modules in JS compilation. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.GlobalAttribute
member.summary: The module, type, function... is globally accessible in JS. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Import-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.ImportAttribute
member.summary: References to the module, type, function... will be replaced by import statements. Use `[<Import("default", "my-package")>] to import the default member. Use `[<Import("*", "my-package")>] to import the whole package. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Import-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.KeyValueListAttribute
member.summary: Compile union case lists as JS object literals. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#KeyValueList-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.MutatingUpdateAttribute
T:Fable.Core.PassGenericsAttribute
member.summary: When this is attached to a method, Fable will add the generic info as an extra argument to every call, making it possible to access a type 'T with `typeof<'T>` within the method body

member.name: T:Fable.Core.PojoAttribute
member.summary: Compile a record as a JS object literals. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html

member.name: T:Fable.Core.StringEnumAttribute
member.summary: Compile union types as string literals. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#StringEnum-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.U2`2
member.summary: Erased union type to represent one of two possible values. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.U3`3
member.summary: Erased union type to represent one of three possible values. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.U4`4
member.summary: Erased union type to represent one of four possible values. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.U5`5
member.summary: Erased union type to represent one of five possible values. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.name: T:Fable.Core.U6`6
member.summary: Erased union type to represent one of six possible values. More info: http://fable.io/docs/interacting.html#Erase-attribute

member.summary: Used to indicate that a member is only implemented in native Javascript

member.name: T:Fable.Core.JsInterop.JsFunc
member.summary:
Use it to cast dynamic functions coming from JS. If you know the argument and return types, use `System.Func<>` instead. If you need a constructor (must be applied with `new` keyword), use `JsConstructor`.
## Sample let f: JsFunc = import "myFunction" "./myLib" f.Invoke(5, "bar")

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.jsThis``1
M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.inflate``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a plain JS object (POJO) to an instance of the specified type. This is only intended if you're using a custom serialization method (that must produce same objects as `toJson`) instead of `ofJson`.

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.ofJsonWithTypeInfo``1(System.String)
member.summary: Instantiate F# objects from JSON containing $type info

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.toJsonWithTypeInfo``1(``0)
member.summary: Serialize F# objects to JSON adding $type info

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.ofJson``1(System.String)
member.summary: Instantiate F# objects from JSON

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.toJson``1(``0)
member.summary: Serialize F# objects to JSON

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.toPlainJsObj``1(``0)
member.summary: Convert F# unions, records and classes into plain JS objects DEPRECATED: Use a Pojo record or union

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.importAll``1(System.String)
member.summary: F#: let myLib = importAll<obj> "myLib" JS: import * as myLib from "myLib"

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.importDefault``1(System.String)
member.summary: F#: let defaultMember = importDefault<unit->obj> "myModule" JS: import defaultMember from "myModule"

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.importMember``1(System.String)
member.summary: F#: let myMember = importMember<string> "myModule" JS: import { myMember } from "myModule" Note the import must be immediately assigned to a value in a let binding

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.import``1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Works like `ImportAttribute` (same semantics as ES6 imports). You can use "*" or "default" selectors.

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.createEmpty``1
member.summary: Create an empty JS object: {}

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.createObj``1(``0)
member.summary: Create a literal JS object from a collection of key-value tuples. E.g. `createObj [ "a" ==> 5 ]` in JS becomes `{ a: 5 }`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.createNew(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Destructure and apply a tuple to an arbitrary value with `new` keyword. E.g. `createNew myCons (arg1, arg2)` in JS becomes `new myCons(arg1, arg2)`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.op_EqualsEqualsGreater(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Upcast the right operand to obj and create a key-value tuple. Mostly convenient when used with `createObj`. E.g. `createObj [ "a" ==> 5 ]` in JS becomes `{ a: 5 }`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.op_Dollar(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Destructure and apply a tuple to an arbitrary value. E.g. `myFn $ (arg1, arg2)` in JS becomes `myFn(arg1, arg2)`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.op_DynamicAssignment(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Dynamically assign a value to a property of an arbitrary object. `myObj?propA <- 5` in JS becomes `myObj.propA = 5` `myObj?(propA) <- 5` in JS becomes `myObj[propA] = 5`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.op_Dynamic(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Dynamically access a property of an arbitrary object. `myObj?propA` in JS becomes `myObj.propA` `myObj?(propA)` in JS becomes `myObj[propA]`

member.name: M:Fable.Core.JsInterop.op_BangBang``2(``0)
member.summary: Has same effect as `unbox` (dynamic casting erased in compiled JS code). The casted type can be defined on the call site: `!!myObj?bar(5): float`

member.name: P:Fable.Naming.genericPlaceholderRegex
member.summary: Matches placeholders for generics in an Emit macro like `React.createElement($'T, $0, $1)`

member.name: P:Fable.Naming.ignoredCompilerGenerated
member.summary: Methods automatically assigned by the F# compiler for unions and records. Ignored by Fable.

member.name: P:Fable.Naming.ignoredInterfaces
member.summary: Interfaces automatically assigned by the F# compiler to unions and records. Ignored by Fable.

member.name: P:Fable.Naming.replacedInterfaces
member.summary: Calls to methods of these interfaces will be replaced

member.name: P:Fable.Naming.targetFileExtension
member.summary: This is null to keep compatibility with Require.js (which expects paths not to have extensions), in the future this will probably be changed to ".js"

member.name: M:Fable.Path.getRelativeFileOrDirPath(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a relative path from one file or folder to another.
